content: On September 8, 1993, the Atlanta Braves showcased their dominance in the National League as they faced the Chicago Cubs. In this game, Braves pitcher Greg Maddux achieved a remarkable feat, recording his 20th win of the season. This victory was part of Maddux's incredible run, where he would go on to win the Cy Young Award that year, solidifying his status as one of the game's elite pitchers.
